qas.question: Who did not capture the city of Namchonjam?
What was the capital city in the North?
Where did Kim Il-Sung temporarily move the capital?
What caused the North Koreans to move their capital for the second time?

context: Meanwhile, on 10 October 1950, the 89th Tank Battalion was attached to the 1st Cavalry Division, increasing the armor available for the Northern Offensive. On 15 October, after moderate <a0_0>KPA<a0_0/> resistance, the 7th Cavalry Regiment and Charlie Company, 70th Tank Battalion captured Namchonjam city. On 17 October, they flanked rightwards, away from the principal road (to <a1_0>Pyongyang<a1_0/>), to capture Hwangju. Two days later, the 1st Cavalry Division captured Pyongyang, the North's capital city, on 19 <a4_0>October 1950<a4_0/>. Kim Il Sung and his government temporarily moved its capital to <a2_0>Sinuiju<a2_0/> – although as <a3_0>UNC forces approached<a3_0/>, the government again moved – this time to Kanggye.
